completeCards.description: The text in your proposal cards will be aggregated and exported as a PDF file.
completeCards.title: Double check that all your proposal cards are complete

exportPdf.description: Your reviewers will be viewing your proposal as a PDF. It is important to check over your proposal as a PDF before submitting. You will also want to make sure to save your PDF so you can refer back to your original proposal at any time.
exportPdf.title: Export and review your proposal as a PDF

recordTime.description: This will allow you to put an estimated time to complete on your study page so that participants are aware and can budget time accordingly.
recordTime.title: Record how long it takes for a participant to complete your study

reviewStudyPage.description: Think critically about what information you want to allow your participants to see on the study page. You may not want to have any information in the study page that would directly influence participants' performance on a task/survey.  Are there any details about your study that is best revealed at the completion of your study?
reviewStudyPage.title: Review your study page. That's what your participants and reviewers will see

testAsParticipant.description: It's important to test with at least 2 people before asking your peers to review your study. This testing phase often helps researchers to find errors in study design and allows time to correct for such errors that would otherwise compromise the data.
testAsParticipant.title: Have at least 2 people test what it's like to be a participant in your study

createBlock.howTo1: Write English content using the fields below this block AND UPDATE/CREATE the block. (This should have populated the field under the English tag in the i18n editor.)
createBlock.howTo2: Select a language below to edit the content for each of these fields in that language. Note that some fields may be displayed in English because they are derived from the internal task code, which cannot be translated.
createBlock.intro: Use this editor to provide a translation of your block in the language of your choice. (i18n = internationalization)
createBlock.notes1: English content may be modified from the i18n editor, but be sure that you have created the task first.
createBlock.notes2: You may notice that the "resources" and "aggregateVariables" are formatted as a list. Ensure that you keep this formatting sanitized!

review.intro: Whether you're starting your study or collecting participants, use this page to review community brainstorms and studies.
review.overviewIntro: Whether you're starting your study or collecting participants, use this page to give feedback to your fellow peers on their proposals and finalized studies
review.sortedByLeastComments: , sorted by least to most comments
review.sortedByLeastParticipants: , sorted by least to most participants
review.sortedByMostComments: , sorted by most to least comments
review.sortedByMostParticipants: , sorted by most to least participants

reviewDetail.addTaskSuggestion: Add MindHive survey or task suggestions
reviewDetail.cannotViewSection: You cannot view this section yet
reviewDetail.cannotViewSectionDescription: To access this section, you must review or participate in the study once it moves beyond the proposal phase.
reviewDetail.helpPeers: Help your peers create studies by offering feedback and suggestions.
reviewDetail.helpStudents: Help students create studies by offering feedback and suggestions.
reviewDetail.noIndividualWork: No individual work found for the selected student.
reviewDetail.resubmitConfirm: Are you sure you want to resubmit? Your feedback will be updated.
reviewDetail.submitConfirm: Are you sure you want to submit? Your feedback will be visible for others. You can edit your feedback after submission.

reviewProposal.instruction: Once you submit your proposal or study, your reviews will appear here.

reviewTemplate.additionalComments: Use the space below for any additional comments or suggestions.
reviewTemplate.additionalCommentsSubtitle: You can mention anything here, but you might consider: clarity and/or relevance of the investigation question, feasibility within the scope of MindHive, ethical obstacles, study motivation/background research, alignment of participant population with the investigation question.
reviewTemplate.confoundsQuestion: How do the researchers address potential confounds and biases in their study design?
reviewTemplate.confoundsSubA: If the researchers are unable to account for some of these confounds or biases in their study design, how do they address them in their study proposals (e.g. alternative explanations/study limitations)?
reviewTemplate.confoundsSubB: What changes would you make to the study design to minimize researcher bias or the impacts of confounds? Explain your answer.
reviewTemplate.designQuestion: How well does the study design address the investigation question?
reviewTemplate.designSubA: Consider whether the study design (i.e. tasks and surveys used; study flow) would generate the data necessary to answer the investigation question.
reviewTemplate.designSubB: How might you improve on the study design? Explain your answer.
reviewTemplate.hypothesisSubA: Consider whether the independent and dependent variables are identified in the hypothesis and whether they are aligned with the investigation question.
reviewTemplate.hypothesisSubB: How would you improve the hypothesis? Explain your answer.
reviewTemplate.importanceQuestion: How important is the investigation question?
reviewTemplate.importanceSubA: Consider whether it addresses a problem that is relevant to society or fills a knowledge gap in a particular field.
reviewTemplate.importanceSubB: How would you revise the investigation question to clarify its importance? Explain your answer.
reviewTemplate.isQuestionAnswerable: Is the investigation question answerable using MindHive tools? Do the proposed tasks and surveys align with the investigation question? Do you have any suggestions for additional or alternative tasks and surveys that might be suitable for this investigation question?
reviewTemplate.needsMinorAdjustmentsSubtitle: The proposal is mostly complete but could benefit from small improvements or refinements, such as clarifying the investigation question or addressing minor gaps.
reviewTemplate.needsSignificantWorkSubtitle: The project is incomplete or has major gaps that need attention. It may require more research, a clearer structure, or additional content before moving forward.
reviewTemplate.oneSentence: This could just be one sentence.
reviewTemplate.participationQuestion: What was it like to participate in the study?
reviewTemplate.participationSubA: Consider whether the instructions were clear and whether the topic and activities were interesting. Did the study activities allow you to accurately represent your real life choices and behaviors? Why or why not?
reviewTemplate.participationSubB: How would you improve the study to motivate participants to put time and effort into their responses? Explain your answer.
reviewTemplate.proposalReadyQuestion: Is this proposal ready to move forward or do you feel it needs further development or revisions?
reviewTemplate.readyToMoveForwardSubtitle: The proposal demonstrates solid understanding and completion of the necessary steps.
reviewTemplate.requiresReevaluationSubtitle: The proposal may be too ambitious or too narrow for the current phase. It might need to be redefined or adjusted before moving forward.
reviewTemplate.respectQuestion: How well does the study respect participants‚Äô privacy, health, and effort?
reviewTemplate.respectSubA: Are the study‚Äôs difficulty and duration appropriate?
reviewTemplate.respectSubB: What improvements would you suggest to ensure that this study is more respectful of participants? Explain your answer.
reviewTemplate.whatDoesStudyDoWell: What does the study do well?

section.deleteSectionConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this proposal section? All cards in this section will be deleted as well. This action cannot be undone.

settingsBlock.askForSonaIdDesc: Ask participants for NYU SONA ID
settingsBlock.askForZipDesc: Visitors will be asked to type in their zip code when joining the study
settingsBlock.autoLaunchDesc: Participants will be automatically taken to the first task after joining the study
settingsBlock.connectExternalDevicesDesc: Shows the plugin for external devices during the task
settingsBlock.emailNotificationsDesc: Show the email notifications prompt after each task/survey
settingsBlock.nycStudentsDesc: Ask participants whether they are students of a public school in NYC
settingsBlock.onlyOver18Desc: Only allow participants over 18 to take part in this study
settingsBlock.onlyTeachersCanEditIRB: Only teachers, scientists, and administrators can add or edit IRB forms.
